author: twgdmj7

review: I can't say enough good things about this device!The GUI looks good, and the way it starts streaming instantly is pretty amazing. My previous streaming devices have been Sony, and the Fire TV blows them out of the water in both performance and aesthetics.There is however an issue with wireless network passwords. The Fire TV will not authenticate your connection if your password is 18 characters long and contains the characters / and \. Don't bother contacting tech support to ask them if the problem is with your password length, or the special characters. You will only end up hanging up in frustration.
author: J. Isaac

review: Great product.  easy to install/use.  Apps are pretty well thought out and haven't had many issues with them.  It would be nice if some apps came with instructions or tutorial to make it easier to follow.  For Amazon prime account holders its really a must have item to take advantage of all those free movies.  It would be nice if they allowed you to filter by free or pay. Well thought out product.

He LOVES it! Will buy another for a friend soon!
author: colleen drew

review: With Netflix and Hulu added to our Prime, it's all we use since it arrived. We are still exploring the additional media apps, but are so far very pleased. The voice command works for everyone, even the toddlers. Many shows we watch on Netflix or Hulu are not Prime and the voice command only works to find Amazon media. But the menus are simple to navigate and the little ( easy to lose) remote has very simple, clear buttons. There's an option to sync with the kindle and flick media over, neat.Only major concern so far is that when I set the parental controls nearly all the children's Prime content was blocked on all our Fire devices. After much research and trial and error with customer support it seems that as most the shows are unrated, they are blocked. So to access kid content, we have to remove parental controls. I hope Amazon will allow parents to override individual shows or otherwise resolve this issue.

author: RichardS

review: I've had Apple TVs for years and have been relatively happy with them. This is definitely better than they are, though. When I am using an app that is available on both Apple TV and Fire TV, I always go to the Fire TV. It is much faster than the Apple TV, and the way apps are displayed is based upon which you have used most recently. Primarily we use it for Netflix and Hulu Plus, but dip into the Prime content on occasion.The voice command works for finding Amazon content, but I cannot get it to locate a show on the Netflix or Hulu Plus apps. That requires either scrolling through, or using the remote to enter text. That's annoying, but it's no different from using Apple TV or Roku.
